page.title: 12Strathairly game farm.
page.content: The Strathairley game farm was set up in 1970 and deals mainly with pheasants and small numbers of partridges. Partridges are bought as eggs,hatched and then sold. The pheasants are mostly of the English ring neck variety. The game farm has an area of 45.2 h.a. but only half is used to rear the birds as the area has a rotation plan. One area will grow barley one year and the other will be used to rear the birds.This rotation is followed each year. All British pheasants were originally introduced from Tibet and a great many now live in the wild having been introduced by man in the past.The farming area at the present time is used for one large rearing field and two smaller mixed pens for older birds.
